intro: Alsophila formosana, commonly known as the Formosa tree fern, is a species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its fronds are typically dark green and can grow up to 3 meters in length, contributing to its striking appearance. Alsophila formosana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
